name: 1,3,5-tris(2-hydroxyethyl)cyanuric acid
Reason: 1,3,5-tris(2-hydroxyethyl)cyanuric acid has a melting point that can be predicted by analyzing its functional groups. The basic unit of analysis is cyanuric acid, which has a melting point of 100°C. The presence of three hydroxyethyl groups increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. Each hydroxyethyl group raises the melting point by approximately +20°C. Additionally, the cyanuric acid moiety itself has a melting point of 100°C.
